body:
I read the documentation:

http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial_sc16_spack_basics.html

I can install packages using `spack install`. What is the "spack" way to actually use them? How do I find the path to the installed library, so that I can use it in my own projects? How do I find the path to the `bin` directory of the `paraview` package, so that I can launch paraview?

The only mention I found was in the "advanced usage", but I would think this should be the most basic usage:

http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial_sc16_spack_basics.html#advanced-spack-find-usage

it says that `spack find -pe` will give me the full path to the installed packages, so then I can use it to launch things.
title: How to use packages that are installed
